icd10_codes.evidence: Once confirmed in the diagnosis of sinusitis in the cephalosporin, it was decided to admit the patient to the hospital for a correct evolutionary surveillance of the patient and start intravenous antibiotic treatment
After a catarrhal of one week of evolution, with general malaise, dry cough and fever (up to 38.5 oC)
the patient develops global headache, more intense in the frontal region, in the last 48 hours
Among the personal history, only infectious mononucleosis stands out

icd10_codes.description: Rash and other nonspecific skin eruption
icd10_codes.evidence: A skin rash maculous and erythematous neck affects the trunk and neck

icd10_codes.description: Elevated white blood cell count, unspecified
icd10_codes.evidence: highlighting leukocytosis with the presence of young sinuses (cayed: 0,3dl)
Isolatedly, he had minimal purulent nasal secretion that has ever been bloody in recent days
